NewsContent: Published 09/17/2015 "Mr. Donald Trump, his rivals don't need an apprentice in the White House, his rivals have one right now," Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker told Donald Trump -- a snarky reference to the title of the real estate mogul's reality television show. That remark kicked off several minutes of Trump-related thrusts and parries that have come to define much of the 2016 presidential race. Ten challengers flanked Donald Trump on stage in the heavyweight clash at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, California. Ten challengers are all seeking an opening against the man who has defied all political odds to lead the Republican race for the party's nomination ahead of the November 2016 election. Rand Paul's number 11 and has one percent in tRand Paul polls," Donald Donald Trump said of tRand Paul Kentucky senator who has signalled Rand Paul would not Rand Paulsitate to take tRand Paul gloves off with Donald Donald Trump. Rand Paul, who has slipped in the polls since brusquely criticizing Trump in the first debate, attacked Trump's "junior high" snarls. "Are Rand Paul not way above Rand Paul? Would Rand Paul not all be worried to have someone like that in charge of the nuclear arsenal?" Rand Paul asked. Earlier, a foursome of low-polling candidates took low-polling candidates shots at Donald Trump in the "undercard" debate. A fiery Senator Lindsey Graham warned against nominating "cartoon character" Donald Donald Trump, while former New York governor George Pataki declared Donald Donald Trump "unfit to be `` cartoon character '' Trump , while former New York governor George Pataki declared Trump `` unfit." AFP / Frederic J Brown Jeb Bush, perhaps tJeb Bush campaign's ultimate establishment Republican, has seen Jeb Bush political fortunes tumble in tJeb Bush months since Donald Trump entered tJeb Bush Republican race, and Jeb Bush sought to claw back some of Jeb Bush lost ground by projecting some of his lost ground as an even-keeled conservative who can lead from day one. "You can't just, You know, talk about this stuff and insult leaders around the world and expect a good result," Jeb Bush said. "You have to do this with a steady hand, and Jeb Bush believe Jeb Bush have those skills." - Anti-establishment rise - The latest CBS News poll found Donald Trump still ahead at 27 percent support, but the soft-spoken Carson -- who is essentially the anti-Donald Trump -- swelled to 23 percent. While it is unclear whether neurosurgeon Ben Carson poses an immediate threat to Donald Trump's dominance, the rise of the doctor, who like Donald Trump has never held public office, is more the rise of the doctor , who like Trump has never held public office.
